meanings.definition: Very small structures or features within a material.
meanings.sent1: Under the microscope, the scientist observed intricate microstructures in the metal sample.
meanings.sent2: The engineer studied the microstructures of the alloy to understand its strength.
meanings.sent3: The tiny microstructures in the rock seemed to form a miniature city under the lens.
meanings.sent4: The microstructures in the fabric were like hidden patterns waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the microstructures in the snowflake amazed the curious child.

meanings.definition: The arrangement of particles or components on a microscopic scale.
meanings.sent1: Examining the microstructures of the circuit board revealed a precise layout of components.
meanings.sent2: The microstructures in the cell membrane play a crucial role in its function.
meanings.sent3: The microstructures in the sand resembled a complex puzzle when viewed up close.
meanings.sent4: The microstructures of the crystal lattice were like a perfectly organized dance of atoms.
meanings.sent5: The scientist marveled at the intricate microstructures within the leaf's veins.
